H0.text: Who wrote ‘It’s a Battlefield’ (1934) and ‘The Power and the Glory’ (1940). Graham Greene

H1.text: Who wrote ‘It’s a Battlefield’ (1934) and ‘The Power and the Glory’ (1940). George Orwell

H2.text: Who wrote ‘It’s a Battlefield’ (1934) and ‘The Power and the Glory’ (1940). Aldous Huxley

H3.text: Who wrote ‘It’s a Battlefield’ (1934) and ‘The Power and the Glory’ (1940). Greenean

A4.text: In the early 1930s Greene moved to the left politically. He read left-wing writers like G.D.H. Cole and John Strachey; in 1933 he joined the Independent Labour Party. This move to the left is reflected in the characters and plot of his fifth novel It's A Battlefield.

A5.text: That voyage produced two books, the nonfiction The Lawless Roads (published as Another Mexico in the US) and the novel The Power and the Glory.
